com.github.fge.filesystem.driver

Class FileSystemDriverBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.fge.filesystem.driver.FileSystemDriverBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FileSystemDriver, Closeable, AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    UnixLikeFileSystemDriverBase

    @ParametersAreNonnullByDefault
public abstract class FileSystemDriverBase
extends Object
implements FileSystemDriver
    A FileSystemDriver with some reasonable defaults

    The (overridable) defaults are:

    • only basic file attributes are supported;
    • no support for UserPrincipalLookupServices or WatchServices (both relevant methods throw an UnsupportedOperationException);
    • no support for SeekableByteChannels;
    • isSameFile(Path, Path) returns true if and only if both arguments are equal.
    See Also:
    UnixLikeFileSystemDriverBase

        Obtain a new SeekableByteChannel from a path for this filesystem

        Note that a SeekableByteChannel supports both reads and writes.

        Specified by:

        options - the set of open options

        a channel
        Throws:

        See Also:

      • isSameFile

        public boolean isSameFile(Path path,
                 Path path2)
                   throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: FileSystemDriver
        Tell whether two paths actually refer to the same resource on this filesystem

        Note that this DOES NOT apply to symbolic links, if the filesystem supports them; that is, if path is a symlink to path2, they are not the same file. Also, in spite of the method name, this method can be called on paths which are not regular files but directories, symlinks or others.

        Two paths which are equal are always the same.

        Specified by:
        isSameFile in interface FileSystemDriver
        Parameters:
        path - the first path
        path2 - the second path
        Returns:
        true if and only if both path
        Throws:
        IOException - filesystem level error, or a plain I/O error
        See Also:
        FileSystemProvider.isSameFile(Path, Path)
